title: What ACRO-R Supports
text: page provides comprehensive overview ACRO’s capabilities. ACRO supports wide range statistical analysis functions automated disclosure control.

previous_headings: What ACRO-R Supports > Supported Data Analysis Functions
title: What ACRO-R Supports
text: Researchers: Create frequency tables cross-tabulations automatic cell suppression small counts. ACRO Supports: crosstab() - Cross-tabulation two variables frequency counting pivot_table() - Spreadsheet-style pivot tables aggregation functions table() - Simple frequency tables categorical data (R interface ) Technical Details: ACRO suppresses, reports reason , value aggregation statistic (mean, median, variance, etc.) cell deemed sensitive. N-K Rule: dominance test top N contributors account K% total, cell considered disclosive. Frequency Threshold: Cells fewer specified number contributors suppressed. thresholds configurable via YAML configuration files. detailed methodology, see research paper. Automatic flagging negative missing values human review. Example Use Cases: - Survey response analysis demographics - Clinical trial outcome tables - Market research cross-tabulations - Educational assessment reporting

previous_headings: What ACRO-R Supports > Supported Data Analysis Functions
title: What ACRO-R Supports
text: Researchers: Run regression analyses automated checks model outputs residual degrees freedom. ACRO Supports: ols() - Ordinary Least Squares linear regression logit() - Logistic regression binary outcomes probit() - Probit regression binary outcomes Technical Details: - regressions linear, probit, logit, tests verify number residual degrees freedom exceeds threshold. - functionality acts wrapper around standard statistical packages. Example Use Cases: - Economic modeling policy analysis - Medical research clinical studies - Social science research - Business analytics forecasting

previous_headings: What ACRO-R Supports > Disclosure Control Features
title: What ACRO-R Supports
text: ACRO Checks: Tables: - Minimum cell counts (frequency thresholds) - Dominance rules (N-K rules concentration) - Presence negative missing values Statistical Models: - Residual degrees freedom thresholds - Model fit diagnostics - Parameter significance testing Non-Technical Users: ACRO automatically identifies research outputs might reveal sensitive information individuals organizations, applying industry-standard privacy protection rules without requiring manual review every result.

previous_headings: What ACRO-R Supports > Disclosure Control Features
title: What ACRO-R Supports
text: ACRO Provides: Suppression Masks - Clear indication results hidden Summary Reports - Detailed explanation disclosure checks performed Audit Trails - Complete record analysis steps decisions Exception Handling - Process requesting release flagged outputs Workflow Integration: finalise() function : 1. Check output “fail” “review” status exception (asked enter one). 2. Write outputs directory. directory contains everything output checkers need make decision.

title: What ACRO-R Supports
text: ACRO Works: - Trusted Research Environments (TREs) - Data safe havens - Secure data centers - Academic research computing facilities - Government statistical offices - Healthcare research environments

what: ACRO: Tools for the Semi-Automatic Checking of Research Outputs
title: Welcome to ACRO-R
text: repository maintains ACRO R package, interface Python ACRO package. ACRO free open source tool supports semi-automated checking research outputs (SACRO) privacy disclosure within secure data environments. SACRO framework applies best-practice principles-based statistical disclosure control (SDC) techniques --fly researchers conduct analysis. SACRO designed assist human checkers rather seeking replace current automated rules-based approaches. ACRO package sits well-known analysis tools produce outputs tables, plots, statistical models. package adds functionality : automatically identify potentially disclosive outputs range commonly used disclosure tests; apply optional disclosure mitigation strategies requested; report reasons applying SDC; produce simple summary documents trusted research environment staff can use streamline workflow maintain auditable records. creates explicit change dynamics SDC something done researchers rather , enables efficient communication checkers. graphical user interface (SACRO-Viewer) supports human checkers displaying requested output results checks immediately accessible format, highlighting identified issues, potential mitigation options, tracking decisions made.

title: Welcome to ACRO-R
text: using function package, acro object initialised using following R code:

title: Welcome to ACRO-R
text: github-pages contains pre-built documentation. Additionally, see paper describing SACRO framework learn principles-based SDC methodology usage.

title: Welcome to ACRO-R
text: work funded UK Research Innovation Grant Numbers MC_PC_21033 MC_PC_23006 part Phase 1 Data Analytics Research Environments UK (DARE UK) programme, delivered partnership Health Data Research UK (HDR UK) Administrative Data Research UK (ADR UK). specific projects Semi-Automatic checking Research Outputs (SACRO; MC_PC_23006) Guidelines Resources AI Model Access Trusted Research environments (GRAIMATTER; MC_PC_21033). project also supported MRC EPSRC [grant number MR/S010351/1].

what: ACRO: Tools for the Semi-Automatic Checking of Research Outputs
title: A Tool for Semi-Automating the Statistical Disclosure Control of Research Outputs
text: repository maintains ACRO R package, interface Python ACRO package. ACRO free open source tool supports semi-automated checking research outputs (SACRO) privacy disclosure within secure data environments. SACRO framework applies best-practice principles-based statistical disclosure control (SDC) techniques --fly researchers conduct analysis. SACRO designed assist human checkers rather seeking replace current automated rules-based approaches. ACRO package lightweight Python tool sits well-known analysis tools produce outputs tables, plots, statistical models. package adds functionality : automatically identify potentially disclosive outputs range commonly used disclosure tests; apply optional disclosure mitigation strategies requested; report reasons applying SDC; produce simple summary documents trusted research environment staff can use streamline workflow maintain auditable records. creates explicit change dynamics SDC something done researchers rather , enables efficient communication checkers. graphical user interface (SACRO-Viewer) supports human checkers displaying requested output results checks immediately accessible format, highlighting identified issues, potential mitigation options, tracking decisions made. Additional programming languages R package supported providing front-end packages interface core ACRO Python back-end.

title: Lung Cancer Survival Data — lung
text: data frame columns: inst institutional identification time Survival time months. status Survival status (1 = death, 0 = censored). age Age patient start study. sex Gender patient. ph.ecog Performance status (Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group). ph.karno 'Karnofsky' performance status. pat.karno 'Karnofsky' performance status assessed patient. meal.cal Daily caloric intake start study. wt.loss Weight loss last six months.
